Package view

Class BoardPanel

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
view.BoardPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible 
class BoardPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
The panel that holds all of the tiles for the game.

    • BoardPanel

      BoardPanel​(Game game)
      Initializes the panel with Tiles to represent the game

  • Method Details

    • inEditingMode

      public boolean inEditingMode()
      Returns whether the view is in editing mode.
      Returns:
      true if the view is in editing mode

    • toggleInLevelEditor

      public void toggleInLevelEditor()
      Switch between editing mode and game mode.

    • highlightAvailableTiles

      void highlightAvailableTiles​(Piece selectedPiece, java.util.Set<Point> availablePoints)
      Highlights all the valid location to place a piece.
      Parameters:
      selectedPiece - the selected piece that will later be added to the board
      availablePoints - collection of points where the selectedPiece can be placed

    • unHighlightAllTiles

      void unHighlightAllTiles()
      Unhighlight all of the tiles, regardless of why there were highlighted earlier.

    • inDeleteMode

      void inDeleteMode()
      Switch into delete mode. Until a LevelEditorButton is clicked again, all tile clicks will be interpreter as trying to remove a piece from a point.

    • updateBoardTerrain

      void updateBoardTerrain​(Board board)
      Update the visual representation of the board terrain. Call it when you first load a level.
      Parameters:
      board - the new board

    • addPiece

      void addPiece​(Point point, Piece piece)
      Visually add where a piece is painted to.
      Parameters:
      point - the point where the texture should be painted
      piece - the piece that is to be painted at the given point

    • removePiece

      void removePiece​(Point point)
      Visually remove where a piece is painted
      Parameters:
      point - the point where a piece should no longer be painted

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      Handler for a button press to implement the necessary logic when the user press a Tile

      void showHint​(Move move)
